column3: 1 Place-Place 8-inch flour tortilla on cutting board
2 scoop-Use a butter knife to scoop nut butter from the jar
3 Spread-Spread nut butter onto the tortilla, leaving 1/2-inch uncovered at the edges
4 Clean-Clean the knife by wiping it with a paper towel
5 scoop-Use the knife to scoop jelly from the jar
6 Spread-Spread jelly over the nut butter
7 Clean-Clean the knife by wiping with a paper towel
8 Roll-Roll the tortilla from one end to the other into a log shape, about 1.5 inches thick. Roll it tight enough to prevent gaps, but not so tight that the filling leaks
9 Secure-Secure the rolled tortilla by inserting 5 toothpicks about 1 inch apart
10 Trim-Trim the ends of the tortilla roll with the butter knife, leaving 1/2 inch margin between the last toothpick and the end of the roll
12 Slide-Slide floss under the tortilla, perpendicular to the length of the roll
13 Place-Place the floss halfway between toothpicks
14 Cross-Cross the floss's two ends over the tortilla roll's top
15 pull-pull the floss ends in opposite directions to slice
18 slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
18 slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
18 slicing-Continue slicing with floss to create 1 more pinwheel
19 Place-Place the pinwheels on a plate
